meanings.definition: To deplete the fish population in (a body of water) by excessive fishing.
meanings.sent1: The fishermen overfish the lake, causing fewer fish to remain.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to overfish the ocean to protect marine life.
meanings.sent3: The fish had a meeting and decided to protest against the overfishing in the river.
meanings.sent4: The consequences of overfishing can be compared to draining a well without replenishing it.
meanings.sent5: The image of overfishing is like taking more cookies from the jar than you can eat.

meanings.definition: To fish excessively in (a body of water).
meanings.sent1: If we overfish the pond, there will be no fish left for others to catch.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen should be mindful not to overfish the stream to maintain a healthy ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The fish threw a party to celebrate the absence of overfishing in their home.
meanings.sent4: Overfishing is like trying to fill a bucket with a hole at the bottom.
meanings.sent5: The concept of overfishing is as harmful as picking all the flowers in a garden without letting them grow back.
